intro: Senecio leiophyllus, commonly known as the softleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are soft and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Senecio leiophyllus is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
